Reviews.Title: “Good but has great potential”
Reviews.Author: Genk91
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here as I was in Madrid on business for three weeks, in and out of the airport. First impressions of the Compostela Suites is fantastic, looks brilliant from the outside with a lovely pool and sunloungers to match. Moving onto the rooms, I stayed in a one bedroom suite which had a small kitchen, living area, bedroom and bathroom. Nice layout with a comfortable bed, sofa, and television with a variety of channels. However the internet is far from good. Rather poor signal, even a Skype call with no video could barely connect and when it did, could only make out every other word, (it was the connection this end and not the other). The internet also decides to have a funny five minutes every hour or so. Great air conditioning in the rooms however my next point is the kitchenware you can purchase if you so desire. The pan handle was so loose that it snapped off on the third use. No sharp knife included which is a hassle, and note no kettle either. I was expecting to come to the Compostella Suites and have access to an oven, however it is only a microwave and a hob. I was also expecting a washing machine as the website describes, but I have to use the one available downstairs which is 3euros for a wash and 2euros for a dry. The other downside to the Compostela Suites is the shuttle bus runs from 6am - 12pm, then 7pm until 1030pm (Those figures may be slightly out), which is far from ideal for a business person who was leaving at 4am and returning at 3pm. Like I said, if the Compostela suites improved the shuttle service, the internet and included an oven in every room, then it would be THE place to be. Overall it is an OK place to stay, however I do have it on good authority that the Aeropeurto suites across the road, include fantastic internet, an oven and a 24hour shuttle bus. I will be there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Victor C
Reviews.Content: Not really impressed, is the second time that I stay, this time whewre dirty sheets, I have asked to be replaced twice but not succes, unlike i was offered to be send clean sheets to be change by myself , not very nice when Im paying for a service. the pool open to late and close to early

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine, and clean and the location was very good ...only it was very pity that the childeren was not allowed to have any kind of toys in the water...it was a little bit borring at the swimmingpool for the childeren...and also we didn't have any garden chairs and table for the lovely terras we had...the appartment is good for family with childeren and for people without childeren...even fot old people...because it has a elevator...

Reviews.Title: “Compostela suites are fab”
Reviews.Author: Nina A
Reviews.Content: I am still at the compostela suites, my two bed apartment is very spacious and clean and modern. I brought my own plastic plates, pan and cuterley. I have a washing machine that I requested and got. The tv channels are fine I am in Spain so expect Spanish channels. The pool is a godsend and clean. The bus goes to the metro and costs E1.50 from a local Makro. It's then E2.00 metro wherever you want to travel in the capital. The centre was definitely worth a visit. Nearby you have a bimbo bread factory which had a shop selling bread at a very cheap price. The shopping centre is 10minutes away and good for food,eating out and time out! I would stay here again as you get aota for your money and at night I understand there is a bus that runs all through the night if you wanted to visit the bars etc. It is used by mainly the Spanish and very clean. Very close to airport. Rooms are cleaned daily

Reviews.Title: “not great...”
Reviews.Author: Rachel H
Reviews.Content: The hotel room itself was very clean and quite large but this is the only plus side about this place, we arrived at the airport only to find we had to wait 3!!!! hours for the shuttle bus whilst waiting we looked on the website and it states nothing about times of the free bus running... so eventually after getting to the hotel we discovered that we would have no shuttle again in the morning to take us back to the airport having to pay a taxi 20 euros, we also booked a early morning wake up call, which we never received luckily we woke early!! and also booked a taxi which again surprise surprise never showed either as they never initially booked it!, we also booked a room for 2 adults 1 child but never had a bed for our 5 year old daughter think they must have meant for her to sleep on the sofa with no covers! luckily as we was going camping we had a blow up bed ourselves of which we used. I stay in madrid quite often and have stayed at a number of apartments/hotels near the airport and I would say that this is the last time I will be staying here........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent is the word to explain the Compostela Suites”
Reviews.Author: snakeflow
Reviews.Content: I fully recommend. Good position, clean and well run. Well done to all the management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “good value apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: 400m23r
Reviews.Content: Very new high quality apartment hotel 5 minutes from Madrid airport. Bakery next door so nice smell of fresh bread in the morning. Small cafteria for snacks or light lunches/dinners. Breakfast not bad. Plenty of buses to Madrid centre a 3 min walk away. Free WI-FI in rooms worked well. Pool closed at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “good place for a stay”
Reviews.Author: andra_m_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed only one night, when travelling to Tenerife. It is a nice complet, we saw the pool and the tennis places. Room is, in fact, an apartament, with livingroom, bedroom, kitchen. Attention, you have all electronics stuff in the kitchen, but no dishes, and i understand from other traveler that renting a fork is expensive (didn't checked it though). Another problem, there are no shops close (or we didn;t found them) or it was very late - we arrived in Madrid at 2 am. They have an automat for drinks, but all was warm, and no water awailable, only sodas, so make sure you get something to drink from the airport at least. The bed was good, the rooms are clean, bathroom is large. From Barajas airport, we paid 15 euros by taxi to get there. It;s a good place to stay if you are just passing trough Madrid, or if you want to relax (pool, tennis).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: dubmar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for 2 months as I was working in the area and it was convenient. Although the place is quiet far from downtown Madrid( approximately 20 minutes by taxi ) the complex is not too far from a shopping centre, but this is the only thing you get as far as entertainment and dining...It is located in an industrial area far from everything. It could get noisy from time to time and the rooms are not really sound proofed. If you stay for a long term, don't expect the room to be clean as the maid come no more than once a week and do the bare minimum. If you want something more than bathroom tissue and new towels once a week, they will charge you 20 EUR per day. Overall, the rooms are minimal but okay, but the service is just terrible. If you are lucky you find someone that will speak a little bit of english, but the simply don't care and the manager tends to hide or run away anytime a customer has an issue... I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A-maz-ING!”
Reviews.Author: BrunoAlex
Reviews.Content: Just wonderful! Clean rooms, quiet, good/ helpful service. Sadly, we only stayed here for one night and it was just the best! I highly recommend this hotel to whoever wishes to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “It would have been a very good hotel, but staffs/housekeepers need more training in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Emjoyran
Reviews.Content: At first impression the hotel is really nice, we don't demand a lot for a kitchenette but it would have been better if there is a kettle. Cleanliness is superb, and love the idea of having fast internet connection in your room...but what made me leave just 2 (or would leave 2.5) stars was the service...For some reason the receptionist forgot to provide us the card that will turn on the electricity for our unit, and it took time for them to figure out what i was asking when i talked to the receptionist about the (card/key). Considering that they market their hotel as having multilingual staffs. The walls are paper thin so you could really hear the sounds from the hall way, bad for someone who is staying with bunch of teenagers/ students who are yapping all the time or people who are drunk or small children playing. Another thing that really really pissed me out of my wits, the rude housekeepers who keep on knocking in our doors even though we put the "do not disturb" sign, they knocked on our doors 3 times! To the point that i have to call the receptionist and confirm them that we are leaving just right before the check out time. it would have been a very nice stay but having the pesky housekeepers just way too much for me. Not really coming back. Rather stay to another hotel where you feel really welcome and not being bullied by the housekeepers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price value apparthotel near Madrid”
Reviews.Author: miguelgarcialop
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent and price value lodging near Madrid airport or Alcalá de Henares. Appartments do have everything they need to be full equipped. Breakfast is very simple but sufficient in size. Swimming pool is open on summer and Wireless internet is very speedy.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special”
Reviews.Author: MessiahAron
Reviews.Content: I was there for a 2 Days...But I wished to stay more. A little apartment WITH EVERYTHING YOU NEED, all things you need to live Confortable. And the only convenient thing was to far from a Subway. But its close to a Buss Station. BY the way GOOD 5 stars for the internet WIRELESS working like a broadband or cable very good and is FREE...

Reviews.Title: “Weird but very good.”
Reviews.Author: felixgunn
Reviews.Content: Although I had planned to fly to Palma I ended up in Madrid so simply needed a bed near the airport. The booking was done for me while I was airbourne from London so I had no idea what to expect. Overall I would have to say it all seemed a bit odd. There are 4 apartment buildings set around a large swimming pool and the 'reception' looks like some sort of security post. The staff however are friendly enough. The whole place looks and feels like you're in the middle of Slough Trading Estate but to be honest it was great. A brilliant little apartment with everything you need and under 50 quid, a bargain. Don't expect a quick ride to the airport though as the courtesy bus visits all the terminals which can take an age as the airport is so vast. Still, at least it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...For one night.”
Reviews.Author: TonyJxx
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this hotel for two reasons. It was close to the airport and it has a free shuttle to said airport. Considering these things I don't have much positive or negative to say about it. The room seemed clean, although it seemed to be missing a few things one would expect, like a remote for the TV more than one towel or glass. The staff seemed pleasant in our brief encounter with them. The metal shutters over the windows also were a bit unsettling, especially when it wasn't really easy to figure out how to shut them all the way. I would recommend it only for its proximity to the hotel and the shuttle, not for any other reason. But on the other hand the full kitchen would save quite a bit of money on going out to eat...but it didn't have any dishes or utensils.

Reviews.Title: “I'm here for 6 months!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sorsola
Reviews.Content: To get into the city you need a bus then a tube but as Spains public transport is very good, this isn't too much of a problem. Not a great deal nearby, but there is a big shopping centre around the corner. This houses a decent supermarket and a load of shops and restaurants. Further down the road there's an Irish bar called The Clover House. They do decent food and the staff are lovely. The staff also speak English which is a big help. Some of the restaurants in the shopping centre only have menus in Spanish and don't speak much English - but they are as helpful as they can be. The apartments themselves are ok. The staff all speak English and there's 24 hour reception. The issue myself and my colleagues have is mainly centred around what they give you to use in the kitchen. It all seems a bit 'lottery' like. Only 1 fork in one apartment, others had 2. Some had no cups, I had 4. No kettle, no toaster. There is a hob and a microwave that grills - but no microwave safe bowls or dishes. I also got 2 frying pans - both of which were filthy and greasy and both handles came off after a vigorous washing. As I said, the location is a tad remote and we are surrounded by offices and a big bread factory. My apartment isn't road facing though so I can't hear anything from that side. What I can hear is the drunk holiday makers coming back from their night out. I understand that this is a holiday complex but this has also been advertised as good for us business folks. There are 4 blocks of apartments - I don't understand why they didn't keep one block for business use and the other 3 for the holiday people. The holiday people slam doors, shout to each other from the opposite ends of the halls and just generally make noise. Not so funny when you've got to get up for work at 6am. Not much good for a lie in either as there usually some child (who has probably just been refused a bag of sweets) going absolutely beserk. So. Apart from the kitchen utensils, it is clean. Ok for a week or two - certainly not for 6 months.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rln72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few minutes away from the airport, but we cant comment on the taxi or shuttle service as we have friends who live in the area, so they picked us up at the airport, and that is why we chose this area to stop in. The hotel is clean and modern, the reception staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is spilt into 4 buildings, so depending which building you are in, the noise will differ. Building 1 overlooks the Bimbo bakery, so you could ask for rooms in another block. We had a 1-bed apartment, with a seperate living room, kitchen and bathroom. It was modern and very clean. The bus stop is a few minutes walk away and there is a bus every 4-6 minutes, a 10 minute ride will take you to the Canellejas Metro stop. Public transport is clean and very efficient. There is a shopping centre near by with a number of bars and restaurants. As I said previously, the reason we chose this area was because our friends live close by, but with good public transport into the centre, its a good base for the price. Our room was 52 euros per night with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: SlovakiaBubla
Reviews.Content: We spent in compastelasuites one day, as we were on the business trip and I was very disappointed. The hotel is nice, rooms good equipped but the service-terrible! First of all, they have free airport shuttle service- we were told to wait at T1 departures where all the hotel busses stop. We spent there about 1 hour waiting; we saw all the shuttles of other hotels but not the ours. My husband called 4 times to the reception to inform about the shuttle, and they told us it was coming in 4 minutes to the airport. After long waiting we took the taxi, that cost us about 15 euro (it is only 4 kilometres, but they charge you for many irrational additional fees). The taxi driver was very rude; he didn’t want to return us left money, only after my husband’s insistence. The approach of the hotel personal was indifferent also later. It is aparthotel, so one would expect the kitchen is ready for guest use. I tis- but the fork, kettle and all the staff is locked and if you want to use it- you have to pay 4 Euros per day. It is a bit ridiculous. Then the internet. The aparthotel is situated in business area, next to the airport. The website of the hotel says it has wifi internet access. We relied on this, because both of us had to work via internet, but it was a big problem. The internet was not working at all, and the receptionist just smiled and told us if we need it, we had to work in lobby. Well, we didn’t see it funny, if such a hotel (not the cheap one) offers something and then does not provide this service. The worst was the attitude of hotel personal; they did not even try to solve the problem. So at all, I really do not recommend this hotel to those who expect services for spent money. There are many other hotels in this area with probably more pro-client attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good airport location.”
Reviews.Author: RandyRandy
Reviews.Content: We were only needing a single night near the Madrid Airport on our way home. The price and location could not be beat! Nice room, comfortable bed, secure parking (extra $), small cafeteria with beer and sandwiches at reasonable prices (only 1 worker who was run ragged, so don't expect anything quick), quick checkin, English spoken, eco-friendly. Laptop could never find the promised Wi-Fi. No problems staying here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Compostela Suites Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Zambrano 4, 28022 Madrid, Spain
